title: Introduce the Axiom of Countable Choice

blocks.name: ax-cc
blocks.content: The axiom of countable choice (CC), also known as the axiom of denumerable choice. It is clearly a special case of ~ ac5 , but is weak enough that it can be proven using DC (see ~ axcc ). It is, however, strictly stronger than ZF and cannot be proven in ZF. It states that any countable collection of nonempty sets must have a choice function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Feb-2013.)

blocks.name: axcc2lem
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ axcc2 . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Feb-2013.)

blocks.name: axcc2
blocks.content: A possibly more useful version of ax-cc using sequences instead of countable sets. The Axiom of Infinity is needed to prove this, and indeed this implies the Axiom of Infinity. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Feb-2013.)

blocks.name: axcc3
blocks.content: A possibly more useful version of ~ ax-cc using sequences ` F ( n ) ` instead of countable sets. The Axiom of Infinity is needed to prove this, and indeed this implies the Axiom of Infinity. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Feb-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Dec-2014.)

  raleq(s0, c0, cif(c0, com, wbr(c0, cen, com)), wrex(s1, c1, w0))
  exbidv(s2, wceq(c0, cif(c0, com, wbr(c0, cen, com))), wa(wf(cv(s2), c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, w1)), wa(wf(cv(s2), cif(c0, com, wbr(c0, cen, com)), c1), wral(s0, cif(c0, com, wbr(c0, cen, com)), w1)))
  anbi12d(wceq(c0, cif(c0, com, wbr(c0, cen, com))), wf(cv(s2), c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, w1), wf(cv(s2), cif(c0, com, wbr(c0, cen, com)), c1), wral(s0, cif(c0, com, wbr(c0, cen, com)), w1))
  feq2(c0, cif(c0, com, wbr(c0, cen, com)), cv(s2), c1)

blocks.name: domtriom
blocks.content: Trichotomy of equinumerosity for ` _om ` , proven using countable choice. Equivalently, all Dedekind-finite sets (as in ~ isfin4-2 ) are finite in the usual sense and conversely. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Feb-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm domtriom(class c0) {
  |- wb(wbr(com, cdom, c0), wn(wbr(c0, csdm, com)))
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
} = {
  impbii(wbr(com, cdom, c0), wn(wbr(c0, csdm, com)))
  domnsym(com, c0)
  sylnbir(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wbr(com, cdom, c0), wcel(c0, cfn))
  isfinite(c0)
  domtriomlem(hs0, hs1, hs3, hs5, c0, cab(hs0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c0), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, cpw(cv(hs1))))), cmpt(hs2, com, cdif(cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs2)), ciun(hs4, cv(hs2), cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs4))))))
  eqid(cab(hs0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c0), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, cpw(cv(hs1))))))
  cbvmptv(hs2, hs1, com, cdif(cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs2)), ciun(hs4, cv(hs2), cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs4)))), cdif(cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs1)), ciun(hs5, cv(hs1), cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs5)))))
  difeq12d(cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs2)), ciun(hs4, cv(hs2), cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs4))), cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs1)), ciun(hs5, cv(hs1), cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs5))), wceq(cv(hs2), cv(hs1)))
  fveq2(cv(hs2), cv(hs1), cv(hs3))
  syl5eq(ciun(hs4, cv(hs2), cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs4))), ciun(hs5, cv(hs1), cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs5))), ciun(hs5, cv(hs2), cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs5))), wceq(cv(hs2), cv(hs1)))
  cbviunv(hs4, hs5, cv(hs2), cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs4)), cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs5)))
  fveq2(cv(hs4), cv(hs5), cv(hs3))
  iuneq1(hs5, cv(hs2), cv(hs1), cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs5)))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs3)
  diff.hs1.s(hs3)
  diff.hs1.s(hs5)
  diff.hs3.s(hs5)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cmpt(hs2, com, cdif(cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs2)), ciun(hs4, cv(hs2), cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs4))))))
  diff.hs3.c(c0)
  diff.hs3.c(cab(hs0, wa(wss(cv(hs0), c0), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, cpw(cv(hs1))))))
  diff.hs5.c(cmpt(hs2, com, cdif(cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs2)), ciun(hs4, cv(hs2), cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs4))))))
  diff.hs2.c(com)
  diff.hs2.c(cdif(cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs1)), ciun(hs5, cv(hs1), cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs5)))))
  diff.hs1.c(com)
  diff.hs1.c(cdif(cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs2)), ciun(hs4, cv(hs2), cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs4)))))
  diff.hs4.c(cv(hs2))
  diff.hs4.c(cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs5)))
  diff.hs5.c(cv(hs2))
  diff.hs5.c(cfv(cv(hs3), cv(hs4)))
  diff.hs5.c(cv(hs1))
}

thm domtriom(class c0) {
  ⊢ (_om[≼]c0 ↔ ¬ c0[≺]_om)
  ⊣ c0 ∈ 𝕌
} = {
  impbii(_om[≼]c0, ¬ c0[≺]_om)
  domnsym(com, c0)
  sylnbir(c0[≺]_om, _om[≼]c0, c0 ∈ Fin)
  isfinite(c0)
  domtriomlem(hs0, hs1, hs3, hs5, c0, { hs0 |(hs0 ⊆ c0 ∧ hs0[≅]P(hs1))}, (hs2 ∈ _om ↦((hs3 ` hs2)\ ⋃(hs4 ∈ hs2,(hs3 ` hs4)))))
  eqid({ hs0 |(hs0 ⊆ c0 ∧ hs0[≅]P(hs1))})
  cbvmptv(hs2, hs1, com, ((hs3 ` hs2)\ ⋃(hs4 ∈ hs2,(hs3 ` hs4))), ((hs3 ` hs1)\ ⋃(hs5 ∈ hs1,(hs3 ` hs5))))
  difeq12d((hs3 ` hs2), ⋃(hs4 ∈ hs2,(hs3 ` hs4)), (hs3 ` hs1), ⋃(hs5 ∈ hs1,(hs3 ` hs5)), hs2 = hs1)
  fveq2(hs2, hs1, hs3)
  syl5eq(⋃(hs4 ∈ hs2,(hs3 ` hs4)), ⋃(hs5 ∈ hs1,(hs3 ` hs5)), ⋃(hs5 ∈ hs2,(hs3 ` hs5)), hs2 = hs1)
  cbviunv(hs4, hs5, hs2, (hs3 ` hs4), (hs3 ` hs5))
  fveq2(hs4, hs5, hs3)
  iuneq1(hs5, hs2, hs1, (hs3 ` hs5))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs3)
  diff.hs1.s(hs3)
  diff.hs1.s(hs5)
  diff.hs3.s(hs5)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c((hs2 ∈ _om ↦((hs3 ` hs2)\ ⋃(hs4 ∈ hs2,(hs3 ` hs4)))))
  diff.hs3.c(c0)
  diff.hs3.c({ hs0 |(hs0 ⊆ c0 ∧ hs0[≅]P(hs1))})
  diff.hs5.c((hs2 ∈ _om ↦((hs3 ` hs2)\ ⋃(hs4 ∈ hs2,(hs3 ` hs4)))))
  diff.hs2.c(com)
  diff.hs2.c(((hs3 ` hs1)\ ⋃(hs5 ∈ hs1,(hs3 ` hs5))))
  diff.hs1.c(com)
  diff.hs1.c(((hs3 ` hs2)\ ⋃(hs4 ∈ hs2,(hs3 ` hs4))))
  diff.hs4.c(hs2)
  diff.hs4.c((hs3 ` hs5))
  diff.hs5.c(hs2)
  diff.hs5.c((hs3 ` hs4))
  diff.hs5.c(hs1)
}

blocks.name: fin41
blocks.content: Under countable choice, the IV-finite sets (Dedekind-finite) coincide with I-finite (finite in the usual sense) sets. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm fin41() {
  |- wceq(cfin4, cfn)
} = {
  eqriv(hs0, cfin4, cfn)
  3bitr4ri(wcel(cv(hs0), cfin4), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wbr(cv(hs0), csdm, com), wn(wbr(com, cdom, cv(hs0))))
  con2bii(wbr(cv(hs0), csdm, com), wbr(com, cdom, cv(hs0)))
  domtriom(cv(hs0))
  vex(hs0)
  isfinite(cv(hs0))
  elv(hs0, wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cfin4), wn(wbr(com, cdom, cv(hs0)))))
  isfin4-2(cv(hs0), universe)
  diff.hs0.c(cfin4)
  diff.hs0.c(cfn)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm fin41() {
  ⊢ Fin4 = Fin
} = {
  eqriv(hs0, cfin4, cfn)
  3bitr4ri(hs0 ∈ Fin4, hs0 ∈ Fin, hs0[≺]_om, ¬ _om[≼]hs0)
  con2bii(hs0[≺]_om, _om[≼]hs0)
  domtriom(hs0)
  vex(hs0)
  isfinite(hs0)
  elv(hs0, (hs0 ∈ Fin4 ↔ ¬ _om[≼]hs0))
  isfin4-2(hs0, universe)
  diff.hs0.c(cfin4)
  diff.hs0.c(cfn)
}

blocks.name: dominf
blocks.content: A nonempty set that is a subset of its union is infinite. This version is proved from ~ ax-cc . See ~ dominfac for a version proved from ~ ax-ac . The axiom of Regularity is used for this proof, via ~ inf3lem6 , and its use is necessary: otherwise the set ` A = { A } ` or ` A = { (/) , A } ` (where the second example even has nonempty well-founded part) provides a counterexample. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Feb-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm dominf(class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wne(c0, emptycls), wss(c0, cuni(c0))), wbr(com, cdom, c0))
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
} = {
  vtocl(hs0, c0, wi(wa(wne(c0, emptycls), wss(c0, cuni(c0))), wbr(com, cdom, c0)), wi(wa(wne(cv(hs0), emptycls), wss(cv(hs0), cuni(cv(hs0)))), wbr(com, cdom, cv(hs0))))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wne(cv(hs0), emptycls), wss(cv(hs0), cuni(cv(hs0)))), wbr(com, cdom, cv(hs0)), wa(wne(c0, emptycls), wss(c0, cuni(c0))), wbr(com, cdom, c0))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wne(cv(hs0), emptycls), wss(cv(hs0), cuni(cv(hs0))), wne(c0, emptycls), wss(c0, cuni(c0)))
  neeq1(cv(hs0), c0, emptycls)
  sseq12d(cv(hs0), cuni(cv(hs0)), c0, cuni(c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  id(wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  unieq(cv(hs0), c0)
  breq2(cv(hs0), c0, com, cdom)
  3syl(wa(wne(cv(hs0), emptycls), wss(cv(hs0), cuni(cv(hs0)))), wbr(com, cdom, cv(hs0)), wf1(cres(crdg(cmpt(hs1, universe, crab(hs2, cv(hs0), wss(cin(cv(hs2), cv(hs0)), cv(hs1)))), emptycls), com), com, cpw(cv(hs0))), wbr(com, cdom, cpw(cv(hs0))))
  inf3lem6(hs0, hs1, hs2, cres(crdg(cmpt(hs1, universe, crab(hs2, cv(hs0), wss(cin(cv(hs2), cv(hs0)), cv(hs1)))), emptycls), com), cmpt(hs1, universe, crab(hs2, cv(hs0), wss(cin(cv(hs2), cv(hs0)), cv(hs1)))), c0, c0)
  eqid(cmpt(hs1, universe, crab(hs2, cv(hs0), wss(cin(cv(hs2), cv(hs0)), cv(hs1)))))
  eqid(cres(crdg(cmpt(hs1, universe, crab(hs2, cv(hs0), wss(cin(cv(hs2), cv(hs0)), cv(hs1)))), emptycls), com))
  f1dom(cres(crdg(cmpt(hs1, universe, crab(hs2, cv(hs0), wss(cin(cv(hs2), cv(hs0)), cv(hs1)))), emptycls), com), com, cpw(cv(hs0)))
  3imtr4i(wbr(com, cdom, cpw(cv(hs0))), wbr(com, cdom, cv(hs0)), wn(wbr(cpw(cv(hs0)), csdm, com)), wn(wbr(cv(hs0), csdm, com)))
  con3i(wbr(cpw(cv(hs0)), csdm, com), wbr(cv(hs0), csdm, com))
  3imtr3i(wbr(cv(hs0), csdm, com), wbr(cpw(cv(hs0)), csdm, com), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), cfn))
  biimpi(wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wcel(cpw(cv(hs0)), cfn))
  pwfi(cv(hs0))
  isfinite(cv(hs0))
  isfinite(cpw(cv(hs0)))
  domtriom(cpw(cv(hs0)))
  vpwex(hs0)
  domtriom(cv(hs0))
  vex(hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wi(wa(wne(c0, emptycls), wss(c0, cuni(c0))), wbr(com, cdom, c0)))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
}

thm dominf(class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ c0 ⊆ ⋃ c0)→ _om[≼]c0)
  ⊣ c0 ∈ 𝕌
} = {
  vtocl(hs0, c0, ((c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ c0 ⊆ ⋃ c0)→ _om[≼]c0), ((hs0 ≠ ∅ ∧ hs0 ⊆ ⋃ hs0)→ _om[≼]hs0))
  imbi12d(hs0 = c0, (hs0 ≠ ∅ ∧ hs0 ⊆ ⋃ hs0), _om[≼]hs0, (c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ c0 ⊆ ⋃ c0), _om[≼]c0)
  anbi12d(hs0 = c0, hs0 ≠ ∅, hs0 ⊆ ⋃ hs0, c0 ≠ ∅, c0 ⊆ ⋃ c0)
  neeq1(hs0, c0, emptycls)
  sseq12d(hs0, ⋃ hs0, c0, ⋃ c0, hs0 = c0)
  id(hs0 = c0)
  unieq(hs0, c0)
  breq2(hs0, c0, com, cdom)
  3syl((hs0 ≠ ∅ ∧ hs0 ⊆ ⋃ hs0), _om[≼]hs0, ((rec((hs1 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ { hs2 ∈ hs0 |(hs2 ⋂ hs0)⊆ hs1 }), ∅)|` _om): _om ↣ P(hs0)), _om[≼]P(hs0))
  inf3lem6(hs0, hs1, hs2, (rec((hs1 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ { hs2 ∈ hs0 |(hs2 ⋂ hs0)⊆ hs1 }), ∅)|` _om), (hs1 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ { hs2 ∈ hs0 |(hs2 ⋂ hs0)⊆ hs1 }), c0, c0)
  eqid((hs1 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ { hs2 ∈ hs0 |(hs2 ⋂ hs0)⊆ hs1 }))
  eqid((rec((hs1 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ { hs2 ∈ hs0 |(hs2 ⋂ hs0)⊆ hs1 }), ∅)|` _om))
  f1dom((rec((hs1 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ { hs2 ∈ hs0 |(hs2 ⋂ hs0)⊆ hs1 }), ∅)|` _om), com, P(hs0))
  3imtr4i(_om[≼]P(hs0), _om[≼]hs0, ¬ P(hs0)[≺]_om, ¬ hs0[≺]_om)
  con3i(P(hs0)[≺]_om, hs0[≺]_om)
  3imtr3i(hs0[≺]_om, P(hs0)[≺]_om, hs0 ∈ Fin, P(hs0)∈ Fin)
  biimpi(hs0 ∈ Fin, P(hs0)∈ Fin)
  pwfi(hs0)
  isfinite(hs0)
  isfinite(P(hs0))
  domtriom(P(hs0))
  vpwex(hs0)
  domtriom(hs0)
  vex(hs0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(((c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ c0 ⊆ ⋃ c0)→ _om[≼]c0))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
}
